conclusion: The light source is currently positioned in front of the objects, casting shadows directly below them.
The light source moves to the back right, meaning the light will come from behind and slightly to the right of the objects.
Shadows will be cast towards the front left of the objects when the light source moves to the back right.
The shadows will be longer due to the light coming from behind, creating more pronounced angles with the objects.
Shadow A (Apple) will move to the front left of the apple.
Shadow B (White Paper) will move to the front left of the white paper.
Shadow C (Glass) will move to the front left of the glass.
Shadow D (Chicken Leg) will move to the front left of the chicken leg.
The shadows will generally become larger due to the increased angle between the light source and the objects.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D move to the front left of their respective objects and become larger.
